text:
TWENTY-FIVE-MINUTE RECORDINGS
14. THE FEDERAL LION. A study of some popular attitudes
toward politics. The story of a male lion, Memoun Bashaw, a gift from
the Emperor of Morocco to President Andrew Jackson, and the result¬
ing tempest in a teapot.
15. THE ORCHID. A study of strength and humility. The story
of early days in the life of George Washington Carver.
16. THE ZENGER TRAIL. A study of faith in the common man.
The story of an historic incident in the struggle between authority and
freedom of the press.
17. AN UNFOUND DOOR. A study of the dedicated spirit. The
story of novelist Thomas Wolfe when as a young man he is offered
security at the price of his dream.
18. THE RESOLUTE. A study of persistence in the face of repeated
failure. The story of Cyrus Field, who on his fifth attempt lays the
Atlantic Cable.
19. PAINT THE BIG CANVAS. A study of visionary planning.
The story of L’Enfant, designer of Washington, D. C.
20. THE FREE MAN. A study of a citizen who stands against social
pressures. The story of Joseph Palmer, who insists on his right to wear
a beard.
21. RUNAWAY JUSTICE. A study of loyalty to state and con¬
science. The story of a southern plantation owner who aids two run¬
away slaves.
22. THE DEMAGOGUE. A study of a warped political campaign.
The story of a man who has to win at any cost.
23. PIONEER CALL. A study of the challenge of new frontiers.
The story of a son who never can be satisfied.
24. MAN OF IRON. A study of courage. The story of Erza Lee
and the first submarine mission.
Please order by name of program
